div.p: ENDURING ANGER AND DESIRE to HARM.
1. The dominant general word referring to intense dislike is wù 惡 (ant. ài 愛 "love") which can relate to all kinds of concrete or abstract objects.
2. Yuàn 怨 is resentment due to identified concrete causes, and the emotion is typically directed towards superiors or equals.
3. Zēng 憎 (ant. ài 愛 "love") is a rather mild and lingering form of resentment directed at a person.
4. Jí 疾 / 嫉 can refer to intense personally focussed resentment.
5. Jì 忌, jí 嫉, and dù 妒 refer to intense personal resentment typically occasioned by envy for some success in love (jealousy) or in politics.
6. Hèn 恨 "nourish feelings of hatred" is relatively rare in this meaning in pre-Qin times, and it stresses the emotional aspect of hatred.
7. Yàn 厭 "come to be fed up with" (ant. hào 好 "be fond of") is a resentment due to overexposure to some condition or to a person's behaviour.
8. Fán 煩 "be irritated at, be annoyed with" refers to a dissatisfaction due to overexposure to some condition or to a person's behaviour.

9. Kǔ 苦 "resent bitterly", huàn 患 "REGARD AS DISASTROUS> be upset by", and bìng 病 "feel profoundly offended" focus on resentment of some prevailing condition as insufferable and may be directed at responsible officials but not primarily in a personal way.
10. Wàng 望 is archaising word typically referrring to resentment against superiors.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Novyj objasnitel'nyj Slovar' Sinonimov Russkogo Jazyka
A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: odium refers to the feeling of hatred as something positive and deep-rooted.
invidia refers to the feeling of hatred as a negative character, like disaffection, and as a temporary emotional disposition.
inimicitia denotes any external and overt enmity which has its foundation in antipathy or disagreement.
simultas refers to an exterior state characterised by hatred, political enmity which has its foundation in rivalry.

Dictionnaire explicatif et combinatoire du francais contemporain, vol. I
Handbuch der lateinischen und griechischen Synonymik
SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse
New Dictiornary of the History of Ideas, 6 vols.

sense.def: hostility in practice, enmity in action; vendetta; hostile acts
be hateful, be unpleasing 令你討厭

entry.def: Jì 忌, jí 嫉, and dù 妒 refer to intense personal resentment typically occasioned by envy for some success in love (jealousy) or in politics.
Jì 忌, jí 嫉, and dù 妒 refer to intense personal resentment typically occasioned by envy for some success in love (jealousy) or in politics.
Jì 忌, jí 嫉, and dù 妒 refer to intense personal resentment typically occasioned by envy for some success in love (jealousy) or in politics.
Jì 忌, jí 嫉, and dù 妒 refer to intense personal resentment typically occasioned by envy for some success in love (jealousy) or in politics.

sense.def: be resentful of; resent (often but not always (cf. LY) out of envy); detest

entry.def: Jì 忌, jí 嫉, and dù 妒 refer to intense personal resentment typically occasioned by envy for some success in love (jealousy) or in politics.

sense.def: hate to V, dislike to V
abhor out of envy and/or fear
be resentful with regard to; feel resentment regarding

entry.def: Yuàn 怨 is resentment due to identified concrete causes, and the emotion is typically directed towards superiors or equals.

sense.def: feel resentment against a contextually determinate person
be indignant against others; resentful (typically towards superiors), be full of indignation; be full of resentment to each other
be indignant or resentful that S (which can be a minor sentence and therefore hard to distinguish on any solid basis from a V)
feel a lasting aggressive indignation and hatred for (often superiors); feel intensely resentful about the fact that; resent; gear a grudge against
cause to hate one> arouse indignation or resentment in
be indignant about S, resent that S
feel indignant resentful or hateful towards N
indignation or hatred directed against N
resentment from the part of the contextually determinate N
have very bad relations with, hate

entry.def: The dominant general word referring to intense dislike is wù 惡 (ant. ài 愛 "love") which can relate to all kinds of concrete or abstract objects.

sense.def: hatred; dislikes (versus likes); bad feelings; hating people
hate openly, detest, dislike strongly; LY 4.3: truly and properly dislike 甚惡"strongly dislike"
be hated, be exposed to hatred
hate it that, hate it when
have relations of hatred with N
cause N1 to be hated by N2
take a hostile attitude towards, act hatefully towards
hate the very idea that S might happen

entry.def: Zēng 憎 (ant. ài 愛 "love") is a rather mild and lingering form of resentment directed at a person.

sense.def: hateful, characterised by a tendency to hate
be disliked or hated; be disliked 憎於人
show comparative dislike for 甚憎
feel and behave negatively towards people, hate people
be full of loathing; hatred, grievance; be indignant
be annoyed with, be irritated at
feel offended by; be enraged; take exception to

entry.def: Jí 疾 feel intense personally focussed resentment.

sense.def: what is hateful or irritating and not conducive to one's purposes
find troublesome and irritating, dislike as something highly inconvenient 最苦
regard as an enemy of hostile competitor> abhor; feel enmity towards, feel hostile towards
be hated; be exposed to hatred
litotes: want to avoid V-ing; dislike V-ing
hate to be V-ed, hate to have V-ing done to oneself
hatred, enmity; resentment of all kinds
resentfully [???SURELY 以 GOES WITH WHAT FOLLOWS!!!CH]
hate each other; be unable to stand each other
activity on the basis of one's personal dislikes
stative word that evokes the atmosphere of omnipresent hatred
storehaus full of resentment; a place of concentrated resentment
one hates N; all of us dislike N
